meanings.definition: The adverse results or consequences of a situation.
meanings.sent1: The fallouts of the decision led to financial losses for the company.
meanings.sent2: The fallouts of the storm included power outages and fallen trees.
meanings.sent3: The fallouts of forgetting your umbrella are getting soaked in the rain.
meanings.sent4: The fallouts of procrastination can be missed deadlines and stress.
meanings.sent5: The fallouts of not studying for the test were evident in the low grade received.

meanings.definition: The radioactive particles that are carried into the atmosphere after a nuclear explosion.
meanings.sent1: Scientists studied the fallouts to understand the impact of the nuclear blast.
meanings.sent2: The fallouts from the atomic bomb were detected in neighboring countries.
meanings.sent3: The fallouts from the nuclear test caused concern among the population.
meanings.sent4: The fallouts of the radiation spread far beyond the explosion site.
meanings.sent5: The fallouts of the nuclear accident were felt for generations to come.

meanings.definition: A disagreement or argument that causes a rift between people.
meanings.sent1: The fallouts between the friends resulted in a strained relationship.
meanings.sent2: The fallouts from the heated discussion were evident in their body language.
meanings.sent3: The fallouts of the debate were quickly resolved with a sincere apology.
meanings.sent4: The fallouts of the argument lingered, creating tension in the group.
meanings.sent5: The fallouts of the misunderstanding were cleared up through open communication.
